Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Organizes styles that will be applied to other controls. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A StyleSheet control can contain any number of style objects, or more specialized style objects that inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> class. These should have unique name properties. You can then refer to other controls on the same page by their <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Name%2A> property. This class has no visual representation.
A page can also use an external style sheet, and several pages can share the same external style sheet. For more information about styles, refer to the [\<style>](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/0048ce21-2c92-4377-a211-9aca9efdf748) element and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet.Styles%2A> topic.
> [!NOTE] > The StyleSheet control ignores its own style attributes; setting a style attribute on the StyleSheet itself has no effect on the styles contained as children within the StyleSheet control.
## Examples The following example shows how you can add Style properties to a StyleSheet control during the `Page_Load` event.
[!code-vb[MobileStyleSheetSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.mobileco_12_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[MobileStyleSheetSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.mobileco_12_1.aspx)]

Docs.param: An object that represents the parsed element.
Docs.summary: Notifies the server control that an element was parsed, and adds the element to the server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.exception: the object to be added does not have a Name attribute.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment Alignment { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified alignment for the style. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: An enumerated value specifying the alignment for the style.
Docs.exception:
The Alignment property was accessed at run time.
-or-
An attempt was made to set the property.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the background color for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The specified background color for the style.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unlike the other properties, the BackColor property is not inherited from its parent. For example, if you set the BackColor property to cyan on a parent control, a child control will not inherit the background color of cyan. You must explicitly set the child control's BackColor property to cyan, or you must set the BackColor property of the parent control and apply the style sheet to the child control. This is consistent with the behavior of cascading style sheets.

Docs.exception:
The BackColor property was accessed at run time.
-or-
An attempt was made to set the property.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool BreakAfter { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that determines whether an additional trailing break is rendered after the control. This break causes subsequent content to start on the next line. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: if an additional trailing break is rendered after the control; otherwise, . The default is .
Docs.exception:
The BreakAfter property was accessed at run time.
-or-
An attempt was made to set the property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is not available in the read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface.
You can use the Clear method for all the classes where this method applies. For example, the Clear method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> collection clears all the styles in the collection; or for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection>, it clears all the choices in the collection.
Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.

Docs.summary: Returns the default style sheet. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default style sheet supports a number of styles.

Docs.value: if the server control maintains its view state; otherwise . The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified foreground color for the style. Typically, this property sets the color for the text. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use the ForeColor property to display text in a different color. For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.ForeColor%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.exception:
The ForeColor property was accessed at run time.
-or-
An attempt was made to set the property.

Docs.value: The object in the style sheet with the specified name.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void LoadViewState(object savedState) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.Object> that represents the control state to be restored.
Docs.summary: Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.SaveViewState%2A> method. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Gets or sets a reference to a user control (.ascx file). The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: A reference to a user control (.ascx file).

remarks.format: ## Remarks The style sheet on the page inherits the styles in a style sheet defined at the root level of the referenced user control. For example, if the style sheet on the user control has a property named `Style1`, the page can access `Style1` as if it were in the style sheet on the page.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the style to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes the specified style from the style sheet. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.exception: The specified style does not exist.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance object SaveViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: Returns the server control's current view state. If there is no view state associated with the control, this method returns .

MemberSignature.Value: public override string StyleReference { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: A reference to the style properties for a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of the StyleReference property must be the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> object.

Docs.exception:
